item.title: Report E-2024060479
item.description:
Report E-2024060479

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed a degreasing agent and granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor. The crew utilized hand tools to work material into the trailer floor. FCE patched the damaged drum and placed it into one (1) 85-gallon over pack. The crew collected the spent absorbents and debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024060487
item.description:
Report E-2024060487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid had a faulty seam and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted areas and placed the damaged drum into a 95-gallon over-pack for disposal. TLE personnel applied granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt surface and worked them in with hand tools. All corrosive liquid impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060431
item.description:
Report E-2024060431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-15
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 5ft-by-14ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that eight (8) gallons of material was released due to load shift that crushed four boxes containing eight (8) 1-gallon plastic jugs. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then a granular absorbent to the impacted areas. The spent material was gathered and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and the damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060417
item.description:
Report E-2024060417

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon can of UN2922 was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized poly sheeting, drums and liners, cleaners and absorbent pads, plug and patch kit, additional pallets, and hand tools to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. TLE personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pail of product. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon vented poly drums to be staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024060027
item.description:
Report E-2024060027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05/20/2024, at 1716 hours, personnel in the CSXT Toledo Docks Lakefront Yard, discovered GATX6902, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and Chemtrade, NRC, Ohio EPA were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2024-05-20-00193). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line closure cap was less then tool tight and could be turned by hand several times. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Mark Logan, 236-885-2466). Contractor personnel secured the cap and decontaminated the car.

item.title: Report X-2024061086
item.description:
Report X-2024061086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: HIGHLAND HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THERMAL TRACKING LABEL AND INVOICE STATING SUPER GLUE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN X 16 OUNCE BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE CA-PLUS QT IV ACTIVATOR. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM OHIO USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER Y21W67, ALLAN VALEO, 7250 ASHBURTON DR, KNOXVILLE TN 37909-3713.
